page.title: 13TURSDALE WORKSHOPS
page.content: The Pit Baths were opened in 1954 by William Welch .The baths were always kept at 70 degrees .There are locker rooms .Each man has 2 lockers , one for clean clothes, and one for dirty. When Tursdale Workshops opened on 11 July 1959 it employed 250 men. By 1970 they had employed 580 men. Now in 1985 there are 370 men working there now. There are men from Peterlee, Crook, Newton-Aycliffe and Chester-le-Street, but the men generally came from Bowburn. Tursdale Workshops have, 29 jib cranes which take 1 tonne,several 20 tonne cranes, several 7.5 tonne cranes and several 5 tonne cranes. Sprockets are made at the workshops. The Workshops supply free overall's, free shoes and free equiptment like goggle's, glasses, helmets and gloves.
